subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
membership:
Rotary is composed of Rotary International/ Foundation and Clubs. Each Rotary Club belongs to a District (average 70-100 members/ Club). The network accounts 1215971 members spread in 35795 Clubs. Each Club belongs to one of the 537 Districts. 
The districts are grouped (average 10) into 40 geographical regions worldwide.
goals__remit:
Rotary brings together a global network of volunteer leaders dedicated to tackling the world's most pressing humanotorian challenges. 
Rotary's Area of focus cover: Basic Education and Literacy,Water, Economic and Community Development, Maternal and Child Health/ Disease Prevention and Treatment. 
Current Rotary top philanthropic goal is to eradicate polio worldwide definitively-TARGET 2018-2020 (started 35 years ago and 15 years of massive effort with major partners)  
Rotary maximizes its impact through innovative public/ private partnerships. 
Rotary supports conflicts resolution and peace keeping as well as international understanding trough education, humanitarian service and by connecting young leaders. 
Since its foundation, Rotary worked closely with other Foundations and organizations, including the the United Nations. It currently holds the highest consultative status offered to a non-governmental organization by the UN's Economic and Social Council. It maintains its relationship with a number of UN bodies,programs and commissions, as well as with World Bank, UNESCO,WHO, Unicef, OECD, Council of Europe, FAO, Commonwealth of Nations and other key non-governmental organizations through its representatives. 
 
The RI President appoints a team of Rotary leaders to serve as RI representatives to the EU (and other organizations), serving as Rotary's "unofficial ambassadors". The RI has decided to create  a Representative function to the EU to work towards strengthening Rotary's participation and reputation at the EU. The team will liaise with other R.I. teams as well the R.I.President's Office and the Rotary worldwide network of Clubs.
relevant_communication:
Organisation of a Conference: " Rotary at the  EU", Brussels , March 8, 2017- Theme: Challenges and opportunities in implementing sustainable development goals, with the participation of Mr Karmenu Vella, member of the E. C. and Mr John Hewko, Gen-sec of R.I. 
 
Global Polio Eradication Initiative (GPEI) including, WHO, UNICEF, Bill-Melinda Gates Foundation 
 
Participation to EDD 2018,  presence in the Development Village
position: Primary R.I. REPRESENTATIVE TO EUROPEAN UNION
